noun.description: An amount of space between two things or people.
examples: I bicycled the short distance home
the distance between front and rear wheels

noun.description: The full length of a race.
examples: he claimed the 10,000 meter title in only his second race over the distance

noun.description: The avoidance of familiarity; aloofness or reserve.
examples: a mix of warmth and distance makes a good neighbor

verb.description: Make (someone or something) far off or remote in position or nature.
examples: her mother wished to distance her from the rough village children

phrases: he went the distance after being floored in the first round
Do you think this fight is going to go the distance?
Who knows what they would have scored had the fight gone the distance?
I'm guessing that Ellis would have won a decision if the fight had gone the distance.
As with the previous four fights, the fifth went the distance.
origin: Middle English (in the sense discord, debate): from Old French or from Latin distantia, from distant- standing apart, from the verb distare (see distant).
